text:
in the previous episode I showed you three of 
our top five noodle soups in Thailand and gave

you some noodle ordering tips now let's check 
out our final two and finish off with a dessert

noodle soup so we are still here at the floating 
market Talad Nam Wat Taling Chan at another

place that sells something called guay jub 
now guay jub is actually a name of the kind

of noodles that they use specific specifically 
for this dish buoyed up is actually a noodle

sheet that when you cook it it rolls up into 
a cigar and the unique part about wake up is

that this dark broth is infused with lots of 
sweet spices like cinnamon and and star anis

and it's got usually tons of entrails like lungs 
intestine you know liver and things like that but

we're here a little bit late and they're almost 
closed so there's only a little bit of entrails

left for me but that's okay it's got a a sweet 
spice kind of flavor the noodles has a little

bit of a chew there are actually two types with 
deaf Nam corn which is this kind where the broth

is dark and with that man sigh where the broth 
is clear and it's actually really hot because

it's loaded with white pepper and you can find 
that kind of toys up in Chinatown in Bangkok

so I can't do a noodle soup roundup without 
something called quick diarrhea or boat noodles

it's very popular oh ha there's apparently 
two thousand places that sell boat noodles

in Bangkok alone so boat noodles were originally 
sold in boats at floating markets and that's why

they are a mini size because selling noodle soup 
in boats you know big bowl of soup is kind of a

danger hazard that's why the people usually have 
two three or multiple multiple boat noodles so the

unique part about boat noodles is the broth the 
broth is dark its flavored with a lot of soy sauce

a lot of different spices and you can order it 
numb buck style and numbly means that they'll add

fresh blood to the to the broth and the blood will 
give richness and body too and otherwise a lighter

and thinner broth so here we go and there's 
usually pork and pork balls sometimes liver

really good it's salty it's always got a little 
bit of sour from some vinegar oh it usually comes

already a little bit spicy and that blood really 
makes creates a nice body for this dish kind of

like vampire noodle soup they usually serve 
this dish with sometimes holy basil like a

pow this is by jota power Thai basil and some 
extra bean sprouts if you want some freshness

and here's a little fun fact about both noodles 
often times you see this chicharrones or crispy

pork skin at the table in a sealed bag and it 
basically works like a minibar you don't have

to have it and you can have it but if you open it 
you'll have to pay for it so that's the system and

now that I've shown you my top five noodle soups 
let's go and take a look at a dessert noodle soup

I always like to end my meal with a little 
something sweet so today will end the show

with also a little something sweet we'll go check 
out a dessert noodle soup now there are a few

different types of dessert noodle soup but today 
we'll check out one of my favorites called lob

cheong and we're here at a place of specializes in 
traditional Thai dessert right by the saponify BTS

sky train station so let's go take a look so here 
is our dessert noodle soup are a lot chunk now a

lot chunk means to go through a hole and that's 
basically how these little noodles are made the

batter is pressed through kind of like a shower 
head like contraption and they just drip out into

noodles at the bottom and it's green because they 
use pandan leaf juice to give it color and also

a really nice fragrance to the noodles now this 
is the syrup that goes with that that's the soup

part and the syrup is made with coconut milk 
and palm sugar and it's also been smoked with

a traditional aromatic candle that's often used 
in Thai desserts to infuse a floral aroma into

various different things so here's how you eat it 
so you just put some of the syrup in here not too

much the syrup is usually very very sweet and 
different places will make them into different

intensity so you just have to gauge how thick the 
syrup is this one's not too thick you always want

to have some ice because this is a cold dessert 
and the ice will also start to melt and kind of

mellow out the sweetness of the syrup a little bit 
you want to stir it well let the ice do its thing

it's so refreshing it's cold it's perfect for 
a hot day like this the texture of the noodles

it's very it's very soft there's no true no 
resistance and it's in it at all it's very

soft and it's so nice and the syrup has a very 
unique floral aroma that's nothing like you've

ever seen before so I highly recommend if you're 
here to give la Chun a try and that concludes my

top 5 noodle soups plus one dessert noodle 
soup if you come to Thailand at least one of

these please give it a try and let me know 
how you like it either on our Facebook or

on my website hot eye-catching calm and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
